Based on the search results, here's what I found about "ralph-mode" for Claude Code:

"Ralph-mode" refers to Claude Code plugins for reliable AI coding. It's part of a system called Flow-Next that includes plan-first workflows, Ralph autonomous mode (designed for overnight coding with fresh context), multi-model review gates via RepoPrompt/Codex, re-anchoring to prevent drift, and receipt-based gating.(no content)There's also an OpenCode port of Flow-Next that provides similar functionality including Ralph autonomous mode with plan-first workflows, multi-model review gates via Codex, re-anchoring to prevent drift, and receipt-based gating.(no content)Ralph Mode is described as an AI-powered production QA tool that can automate code quality checks and fix production issues.

The search results reference GitHub topics related to ralph-mode, suggesting there are repositories and plugins available on GitHub that implement this functionality. You can explore the GitHub topics page at https://github.com/topics/ralph-mode for more details on specific implementations and installation instructions.

content.content:
# Installation Instructions for Oh-My-Claude-Sisyphus

## Quick Installation Methods

**Option A: Claude Code Plugin (Recommended)**
```
/plugin marketplace add Yeachan-Heo/oh-my-claude-sisyphus 
/plugin install oh-my-claude-sisyphus
```

**Option B: Curl One-Liner (Deprecated)**
```
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Yeachan-Heo/oh-my-claude-sisyphus/main/scripts/install.sh | bash
```
⚠️ *Note: This method is deprecated due to potential conflicts with plugin installations.*

**Option C: npm (Windows & Cross-Platform)**
```
npm install -g oh-my-claude-sisyphus
```
Requires Node.js 20+.

**Manual Install (macOS/Linux)**
```
git clone https://github.com/Yeachan-Heo/oh-my-claude-sisyphus.git
cd oh-my-claude-sisyphus
chmod +x scripts/install.sh
./scripts/install.sh
```

## Configuration Setup

After installation, configure Sisyphus using one of these commands:

**Project-Scoped (Recommended):**
```
/sisyphus-default
```
Creates `./.claude/CLAUDE.md` for the current project only.

**Global Configuration:**
```
/sisyphus-default-global
```
Creates `~/.claude/CLAUDE.md` for all Claude Code sessions.

## Important Notes

- "Plugin install and curl install are mutually exclusive. Using both will cause hook conflicts."
- After updating, re-run configuration commands to apply latest changes
- Project-scoped configuration takes precedence over global settings
- Plugin requires Node.js 20+ and TypeScript 5.0+

# Installation Instructions for Oh-My-Claude-Sisyphus

## Quick Installation Methods

**Option A: Claude Code Plugin (Recommended)**
```
/plugin marketplace add Yeachan-Heo/oh-my-claude-sisyphus 
/plugin install oh-my-claude-sisyphus
```

**Option B: Curl One-Liner (Deprecated)**
```
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Yeachan-Heo/oh-my-claude-sisyphus/main/scripts/install.sh | bash
```
⚠️ *Note: This method is deprecated due to potential conflicts with plugin installations.*

**Option C: npm (Windows & Cross-Platform)**
```
npm install -g oh-my-claude-sisyphus
```
Requires Node.js 20+.

**Manual Install (macOS/Linux)**
```
git clone https://github.com/Yeachan-Heo/oh-my-claude-sisyphus.git
cd oh-my-claude-sisyphus
chmod +x scripts/install.sh
./scripts/install.sh
```

## Configuration Setup

After installation, configure Sisyphus using one of these commands:

**Project-Scoped (Recommended):**
```
/sisyphus-default
```
Creates `./.claude/CLAUDE.md` for the current project only.

**Global Configuration:**
```
/sisyphus-default-global
```
Creates `~/.claude/CLAUDE.md` for all Claude Code sessions.

## Important Notes

- "Plugin install and curl install are mutually exclusive. Using both will cause hook conflicts."
- After updating, re-run configuration commands to apply latest changes
- Project-scoped configuration takes precedence over global settings
- Plugin requires Node.js 20+ and TypeScript 5.0+

content.content:
# Ralph for Claude Code - Installation Instructions

## Phase 1: Global Installation (One-Time)

Clone the repository and run the installation script:

```bash
git clone https://[REDACTED_CREDS]@fix_plan.md`, `specs/requirements.md`), then launch:

```bash
ralph --monitor
```

### Option B: Manual Project Creation

Initialize a blank project with templates:

```bash
ralph-setup my-awesome-project
cd my-awesome-project
```

Configure your requirements manually by editing the template files, then start the autonomous loop:

```bash
ralph --monitor
```

## Runtime Configuration

The system requires no npm installation as Ralph is implemented in Bash. All dependencies are shell-based utilities. Key runtime options include:

- `--monitor`: Integrated tmux dashboard
- `--timeout [minutes]`: Execution timeout (1-120 minutes)
- `--calls [number]`: API rate limit (default: 100/hour)
- `--verbose`: Detailed progress output
- `--continue`: Enable session continuity (default)
- `--no-continue`: Disable context preservation

## Uninstallation

For complete system removal:

```bash
./uninstall.sh
```

Or remotely:

```bash
curl -sL https://[REDACTED_CREDS]@fix_plan.md`, `specs/requirements.md`), then launch:

```bash
ralph --monitor
```

### Option B: Manual Project Creation

Initialize a blank project with templates:

```bash
ralph-setup my-awesome-project
cd my-awesome-project
```

Configure your requirements manually by editing the template files, then start the autonomous loop:

```bash
ralph --monitor
```

## Runtime Configuration

The system requires no npm installation as Ralph is implemented in Bash. All dependencies are shell-based utilities. Key runtime options include:

- `--monitor`: Integrated tmux dashboard
- `--timeout [minutes]`: Execution timeout (1-120 minutes)
- `--calls [number]`: API rate limit (default: 100/hour)
- `--verbose`: Detailed progress output
- `--continue`: Enable session continuity (default)
- `--no-continue`: Disable context preservation

## Uninstallation

For complete system removal:

```bash
./uninstall.sh
```

Or remotely:

```bash
curl -sL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/frankbria/ralph-claude-code/main/uninstall.sh | bash
```

content.thinking: Now I have the installation instructions for both. Let me present this clearly to the user.

content.text:
I found the installation instructions for both. Here's how to install them:

`★ Insight ─────────────────────────────────────`
**Ralph-mode** and **Sisyphus-mode** are autonomous coding techniques:
- **Ralph** (named after Ralph Wiggum) uses exit code 2 to prevent Claude from stopping, re-injecting prompts in a continuous loop — great for overnight/long-running tasks
- **Sisyphus** (like the mythological figure) ensures persistence until all tasks complete, with hook enforcement to strengthen the "don't give up" behavior
`─────────────────────────────────────────────────`

---

## Installing Ralph-mode

```bash
git clone https://github.com/frankbria/ralph-claude-code.git
cd ralph-claude-code
./install.sh
```

This adds `ralph`, `ralph-monitor`, and `ralph-setup` commands to your PATH.

**Usage:**
```bash
ralph-setup my-project    # Initialize a project
cd my-project
ralph --monitor           # Start autonomous loop with dashboard
```

---

## Installing Sisyphus-mode

**Option A: Claude Code Plugin (Recommended)**
```
/plugin marketplace add Yeachan-Heo/oh-my-claude-sisyphus 
/plugin install oh-my-claude-sisyphus
```

**Option B: npm**
```bash
npm install -g oh-my-claude-sisyphus
```

**Option C: Manual**
```bash
git clone https://github.com/Yeachan-Heo/oh-my-claude-sisyphus.git
cd oh-my-claude-sisyphus
./scripts/install.sh
```

**After installing, configure it:**
```
/sisyphus-default         # Project-scoped config
/sisyphus-default-global  # Global config
```

---

Would you like me to run these installation commands for you? I can install one or both right now.

**Sources:**
- [Ralph Claude Code - GitHub](https://github.com/frankbria/ralph-claude-code)
- [Oh-My-Claude-Sisyphus - GitHub](https://github.com/Yeachan-Heo/oh-my-claude-sisyphus)
- [Ralph Wiggum Explained - Dev Genius](https://blog.devgenius.io/ralph-wiggum-explained-the-claude-code-loop-that-keeps-going-3250dcc30809)

Exit code 1
Unknown option: --version
Ralph Loop for Claude Code

Usage: /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh [OPTIONS]

IMPORTANT: This command must be run from a Ralph project directory.
           Use 'ralph-setup project-name' to create a new project first.

Options:
    -h, --help              Show this help message
    -c, --calls NUM         Set max calls per hour (default: 100)
    -p, --prompt FILE       Set prompt file (default: PROMPT.md)
    -s, --status            Show current status and exit
    -m, --monitor           Start with tmux session and live monitor (requires tmux)
    -v, --verbose           Show detailed progress updates during execution
    -t, --timeout MIN       Set Claude Code execution timeout in minutes (default: 15)
    --reset-circuit         Reset circuit breaker to CLOSED state
    --circuit-status        Show circuit breaker status and exit
    --reset-session         Reset session state and exit (clears session continuity)

Modern CLI Options (Phase 1.1):
    --output-format FORMAT  Set Claude output format: json or text (default: json)
    --allowed-tools TOOLS   Comma-separated list of allowed tools (default: Write,Bash(git *),Read)
    --no-continue           Disable session continuity across loops
    --session-expiry HOURS  Set session expiration time in hours (default: 24)

Files created:
    - logs/: All execution logs
    - docs/generated/: Generated documentation
    - status.json: Current status (JSON)
    - .ralph_session: Session lifecycle tracking
    - .ralph_session_history: Session transition history (last 50)
    - .call_count: API call counter for rate limiting
    - .last_reset: Timestamp of last rate limit reset

Example workflow:
    ralph-setup my-project     # Create project
    cd my-project             # Enter project directory
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --monitor             # Start Ralph with monitoring

Examples:
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --calls 50 --prompt my_prompt.md
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --monitor             # Start with integrated tmux monitoring
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --monitor --timeout 30   # 30-minute timeout for complex tasks
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --verbose --timeout 5    # 5-minute timeout with detailed progress
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --output-format text     # Use legacy text output format
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --no-continue            # Disable session continuity
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --session-expiry 48      # 48-hour session expiration

    --reset-circuit         Reset circuit breaker to CLOSED state
    --circuit-status        Show circuit breaker status and exit
    --reset-session         Reset session state and exit (clears session continuity)

Modern CLI Options (Phase 1.1):
    --output-format FORMAT  Set Claude output format: json or text (default: json)
    --allowed-tools TOOLS   Comma-separated list of allowed tools (default: Write,Bash(git *),Read)
    --no-continue           Disable session continuity across loops
    --session-expiry HOURS  Set session expiration time in hours (default: 24)

Files created:
    - logs/: All execution logs
    - docs/generated/: Generated documentation
    - status.json: Current status (JSON)
    - .ralph_session: Session lifecycle tracking
    - .ralph_session_history: Session transition history (last 50)
    - .call_count: API call counter for rate limiting
    - .last_reset: Timestamp of last rate limit reset

Example workflow:
    ralph-setup my-project     # Create project
    cd my-project             # Enter project directory
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --monitor             # Start Ralph with monitoring

Examples:
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --calls 50 --prompt my_prompt.md
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --monitor             # Start with integrated tmux monitoring
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --monitor --timeout 30   # 30-minute timeout for complex tasks
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --verbose --timeout 5    # 5-minute timeout with detailed progress
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --output-format text     # Use legacy text output format
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --no-continue            # Disable session continuity
    /Users/[USER]/.ralph/ralph_loop.sh --session-expiry 48      # 48-hour session expiration

content.thinking: Both are installed! The error was just because `--version` isn't a valid flag, but the help text shows ralph is working.

content.text:
Both are installed successfully! 🎉

---

## ✅ Installation Complete

| Mode | Status | Command |
|------|--------|---------|
| **Ralph-mode** | ✅ Installed | `ralph --monitor` |
| **Sisyphus-mode** | ✅ Installed | `/sisyphus-default` |

---

## Quick Start

**For Ralph** (autonomous coding loops):
```bash
ralph-setup my-project
cd my-project
ralph --monitor
```

**For Sisyphus** (persistence mode), run in Claude Code:
```
/sisyphus-default
```

---

`★ Insight ─────────────────────────────────────`
These tools work great together! A common pattern is:
- **Sisyphus** keeps Claude persistent on the current task
- **Ralph** wraps the whole session in a loop, re-injecting prompts if Claude tries to stop early
- Combined, you get "unstoppable" autonomous coding that runs for hours
`─────────────────────────────────────────────────`

**Note:** Restart your terminal (or run `source ~/.zshrc`) for the `ralph` command to be in your PATH.
